Release Process

To release a new version of the Magazine Tool, run the grunt dist command. This will update your dependencies, run a full distribution build and bump the version. Grunt will ask you if this is a patch, minor or major change. The difference between are indicated when you need to choose. If you want to do some further reading on this, read the Semantic Versioning spec.

Once the Grunt task has completed, you will need to upload the changed files to Alfresco. Check the diff for the latest commit on the repo that was created by the Grunt dist command. The commit message should real something like Release: v1.x.x. When you open that commit you should be able to see which files withing the dist directory have changed. Those are the files you need to upload to Alfresco Assets under magazine/_shared/contents/MagTool.

Finally, when you have uploaded the files to Alfresco and published them to staging, create a new release on GitHub using the latest version tag. This tag was automatically created for you by the Grunt dist task.

MagTool is maintained by NAPWebProductionEditTeam.
